title: Understanding the Stages
text: The recovery model in mental health is a framework that outlines the stages individuals go through on their journey to recovery. It's important to understand each stage and its significance.

title: Stage 1: Starting Treatment
text: This stage involves recognizing the need for help and beginning the process of seeking treatment. It is the initial step towards recovery.

title: Stage 2: Mental Illness Education
text: In this stage, individuals learn about their mental illness, understanding its effects and how to manage it effectively.

title: Stage 3: Making a Change
text: This stage is about implementing changes in lifestyle and behavior to support recovery. It involves setting goals and working towards them.

title: Stage 4: Finding New Meaning
text: Individuals in this stage start to find new meaning and purpose in life beyond their mental illness. It involves rebuilding one's identity and life goals.

title: Stage 5: Sticking with Recovery
text: The final stage involves maintaining the progress made and continuing to apply the strategies learned to stay well.
